ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] PLing
ygData.msgSnippet: I good spot to PL some one is in SRo at the orc camps you can take the camps no one is ever there =) and if some one is there I think there are roaming mobs to
ygData.messageBody:
I good spot to PL some one is in SRo at the orc camps you can take the camps
no one is ever there =) and if some one is there I think there are roaming
mobs to kill.

----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Ong <nakor@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 29, 2001 9:15 AM
Subject: [EverQuest] PLing


> Mmm... it's true that the peopel who are getting PLed are not doing
> much work. They level faster than people who actually level
> themselves. I understand how you would think this is not really fair
> but sometimes people like to help others. When I help people, I PL
> them. I won't help them get equipment because that's what you need
> to do for yourself since it generally makes you more powerful
> especially magical items. AND when I PL them, I don't take over
> camps to help them level. I just look around for roaming mobs that
> are not a RARE of course and let them kill it. Heal them when
> necessary. The usual method. I don't steal camps from people or
> camp things when tyring to PL 'em. I know that's wrong cuz if I did
> that I would feel like I'm hogging the camp since I wouldn't get xp
> in the first place and it's a camp that everyone wants to have. For
> example, PLing in cb. I just look for any orcs i see and let them
> kill it. There are hardly any camps in there. The only camps there
> are in cb are in the castle itself and near the tents. Anyway, my
> point is, is that I find it wrong when people take over camps to PL
> but I find it ok when people just kill roaming mobs to PL. AND yeah,
> I don't like when peopel twink. That's why I don't give peopel
> equipment or money. Maybe leather armor but that's about it.
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., "Dan" <danspth@y...> wrote:
> > Opinions vary. I personally find the whole power leveling idea to
> be most
> > dishonorable. To see an orc camp taken over by a 50+ druid and a lv
> 6 ogre
> > warrior in full crafted with a wurmslayer reminds me how people are
> have no
> > willingness to work for things (the whole cheat code thing). But
> many people
> > find it ok to twink/power level and, well, so be it. I can see it,
> shiver,
> > and keep moving. Live and let live. I am fortunate that at lv 43 I
> can solo
> > and this is only an inconvience at worse to me instead of a real
> issue. But
> > up until lv 35 I was still having camps stolen from me by uber
> twinks and
> > anon druids.
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Thomas H. Comegys [mailto:comegys@p...]
> > Sent: Wednesday, August 29, 2001 5:06 AM
> > To: EverQuest@y...
> > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Fighter armor and weapons at low
> level
> >
> >
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "Nygaardr, FC3" <nygaardr@c...>
> > To: <EverQuest@y...>
> > Sent: Wednesday, August 29, 2001 3:08 AM
> > Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Re: Fighter armor and weapons at low
> level
